sub_topic: Determining the isomerism of a molecule
message_1: How many different isomers can be formed for a molecule having the chemical formula C4H10O? Provide the structures for each isomer.
message_2:
There are seven different isomers for a molecule having the chemical formula C4H10O. Here are the structures for each isomer:

1. Butan-1-ol (1-Butanol)
Structure: CH3-CH2-CH2-CH2-OH

2. Butan-2-ol (2-Butanol)
Structure: CH3-CH2-CH(OH)-CH3

3. 2-Methylpropan-1-ol (Isobutanol)
Structure: (CH3)2-CH-CH2-OH

4. 2-Methylpropan-2-ol (tert-Butanol)
Structure: (CH3)3-C-OH

5. Methoxypropane (1-Methoxypropane)
Structure: CH3-O-CH2-CH2-CH3

6. 1-Methoxybutane (2-Methoxypropane)
Structure: CH3-CH2-O-CH2-CH3

7. 2-Methoxybutane
Structure: CH3-CH(O-CH3)-CH2-CH3
